page.title: 03Education,Earlston
page.content: { Earlston Primary}is a mixed non denominational primary school providing primary education. There are 92 boys, 94 girls and 7 fulltime teachers. The infant department operates in a self contained, semi-open plan unit. The upper primary is attached to Earlston High School and certain facilities are shared. The primary building has recently undergone quite radical modernisation. Three classrooms have been made into a big open area. Other rooms are used for music, T.V. and resources. The main curriculum areas are language arts,mathematics, environmental studies and expressive arts.Class work is mainly based on a centre of interest approach which integrates all subjects where possible.
